oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Camp Boxwell, Boy Scouts of America reservation, 1958 July 17
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A scene at Camp Boxwell, the Boy Scouts of America summer camp circa July 17th 1958. This was the third scout camp to bear the name Boxwell, in honor of Mr. L. G. Boxwell, president of the Nashville-area Council of the Boy Scouts of America from 1927-1947. K.C. Hardcastle, Jr. was instrumental in the process to acquire the land for the fourth and current Boxwell Reservation, located on Old Hickory Lake. The Boxwell here was located in Walling, TN on the Caney Fork River and was known as Rock Island. Forms part of Nashville Banner Negatives Collection. 1 photographic negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
